bwwExcerpt: I couldn't help but think of an ATF agent named Peter Forcelli while I watched the super-charged Broadway revival of An Enemy of the People, Henrik Ibsen's play about a man who tries to do the right thing and makes the awful discovery that in his Norwegian town, money is the root of all truth. The man is a whistleblower, and is reviled by everyone for the message he delivers: The water in the town's spas - its lifeblood - has become toxic.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This excerpt only provides plot summary and contextual comparison to a real-world figure, with no evaluative content about the production's quality or recommendation.; openai: The text provided is a plot summary and contextual comparison, not an evaluative review of the Broadway production.
